result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Wade Riley Durham

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on October 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on November 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.

9:51 AM Defendant Wade Riley Durham in court.  Attorney Jaramy J Hansen appeared by video for Wade Riley Durham.  Attorney Chad C La Lor in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Hansen received information, waives reading and pleads not guilty. Court accepts not guilty plea. Attorney Hansen requests status conference in late October. State in agreement.
Status conference scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt:
10:28 AM Defendant Wade Riley Durham in court.  Attorney Chad C La Lor in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Jaramy J Hansen in court for Wade Riley Durham. 
Attorney-Client waives preliminary hearing. Court finds waiver knowing/voluntary; finds probable cause that a felony was committed and binds over for arraignment. Court reminds of bail/conditions.
Arraignment scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
2:13 PM Defendant Wade Riley Durham in court. Peter Kruger in court for the State. Dfd states he has not went over to the PD office but he plans on getting counsel, planning on going to PD office and believes he will qualify as his work hours have been reduced. Court asks if Dfd wants more time to get counsel and explains he would need to waive time. 
Dfd waives time limits for preliminary hearing.
Court accepts waiver of time as voluntary and knowingly. Set 5/25 @ 10:30 for prelim and status 5/23 @3.

ADDRESS INFO for Wade Riley Durham
Current: 1922 Ogden Ave, Superior, WI 54880 United States  (Effective: 05-09-2022)
Prior: 2220 W 4Th St, Duluth, MN 55811

1:53 PM Defendant Wade Riley Durham appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Ellen Craker appears with Defendant.  Attorney Angela Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case. Address verified as 1922 Ogden Avenue, Superior. Attorney acknowledges receipt, waives reading, requests preliminary hearing. State requests $1,500 cash, with no special conditions. Failed to report to jail. Cites priors. 
Craker indicates no missed appearances. Minimal criminal history. Lives in Superior, works in Duluth. could post $500. 
Court orders $1,500 cash, with no special conditions.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status conference scheduled for May 10, 2022 at 10:30 am.
1:57 PM Defendant Wade Riley Durham not in court.  Attorney Mark Fruehauf  in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. State asks for warrant to continue. So ordered.
